name: index.html
info:
uibuilder Blank Template

The first button sends a message back to the main uibuilder node. Attach a debug node to port #1 of that node to see it.

The second button only works if you have first sent a message via a uib-sender node. When you do, pressing the button will return a msg back to the sender node and not to the main node. 

Waiting for a message from Node-RED

Note that there are only around 5 required lines of HMTL and around 30 lines of JavaScript required to make this example work. Thanks to the uibuilderfe library along with uibuilder which do all the hard work. Only 1 line of CSS gives you a decent looking output. üòÅ

name: index.js
Make sure that you take the content of the 3 comments below and \n put them into the appropriate files using the uibuilder file editor
As soon as you import this example, press Deploy before doing anything else. \n This will create the required folders.
If you change the uibuilder URL for this example, \n make sure you Deploy and then change the selection in the uib-sender node to match.
